result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun I O'Keefe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. O'Keefe to 16 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  8  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 8 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 9:11am. [MK]
Defendant Shaun I O'Keefe in court with Attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Count #1, #5, and #6; factual basis stipulated as set forth in the Amended Criminal Complaint; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. O'Keefe   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4, #7, and #8.

9:25am:  ADA Shock alerts the Court that he now realizes that the State has not complied with victim notification as to the victim in Counts #4 through #8.
The Court states its bases for proceeding to Sentencing today, subject to the Court giving consideration to a request from victim CCS for restitution.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. O'Keefe's father, Daniel O'Keefe makes a statement.
Mr. Shaun O'Keefe makes a statement.
9:45am: The Court revisits the Counts #4 through #8 victim notification issue regarding victim CCS:  The Court directs the State to have its victim coordinator contact CCS and to allow him/her to make a victim impact statement and give input.  If the need for reconsideration is needed based on the victim's input, the Court will address this if the need arises. The Court indicates that the State is to follow up with submitting information to the Court on what the victim coordinator learned in the contact with CCS. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. O'Keefe to 16 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  8  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 8 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

On Count #5, the Court sentences Mr. O'Keefe to 3 years and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is consecutive to Count #1.  

The Court finds that Mr. O'Keefe is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. O'Keefe is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 6 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision on Counts #1 & #5:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with Sex Offender Registration and reporting
--no contact with any child under 18 years of age without the consent of the Agent; the Court would be inclined to allow contact with family members under the age of 18 if the Agent were to approve that 
--no contact with JLL or with CCS 
--to obtain/maintain employment or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution for counseling expenses of JLL and CCS under Statute 973.15(4m)
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #5: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


On Count #6, the Court sentences Mr. O'Keefe to:
--serve six months in Jail (may be served in the WSPS) consecutive to Counts #1 and #5
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge; this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment 


The Court requires Sex Offender Register and Reporting for life under Statute 301.45
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 948.13 prohibition from employment or volunteer-work that involves children is imposed; penalties recited 
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited
Contact prohibition/penalty warnings given 
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
As to the DNA surcharge ordered in Count #6 only:   The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
recess 10:00am.
Status conference on December 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 26, 2014 at 10:20 am.

case called at 8:35am. [MK]
Defendant Shaun I O'Keefe in court with Attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Borda indicates that he has been having discussions with DA Happ; Attorney Borda requests the scheduling of another Pretrial so that the plea agreement can be finalized. 
The Court informs the parties that if the case does not conclude on the December 16th date, then by Judicial Rotation this case will be assigned to Branch III/Judge Wambach as of January 1st.
recess 8:39am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/26/14 at 10:20am.   (2) schedule Status Conference (likely Plea/Sentencing) on 12/16/14 at 9:00am

Case called at 1:41 pm
Defendant Shaun I O'Keefe in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
ADA Hall motions the Court to amend the criminal complaint to strike all letters of name except J.L.L. and add DOB: of 1/22/1998.
Court grants the State's Motion and amends the criminal complaint by it's own hand.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1- #3.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any person
-No contact with J.L.L. (DOB: 1/22/1998)
-No contact with any minor female
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 2:02 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 6/20/14 at 9:30 am
